public class PlayerTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void testAddDevelopmentCard()
    Testing the correct assignment of a DevelopmentCard 1)Testing when a DevelopmentCard in a wrong space 2)Testing that Player add only one LEVEL.FIRST DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace 3)Testing that Player add only one LEVEL.SECOND DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace 4)Testing that Player add only one LEVEL.THIRD DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace
    void testAddedPowers()
    Testing when a new power is added to Player
    void testAddResourceToWarehouseAdditional()  
    void testAddResourceToWarehouseStandard()  
    void testDevelopmentCardCanBeAdded()
    Testing when a player can add a DevelopmentCard 1)Testing when a DevelopmentCard in a wrong space 2)Testing that Player can add only one LEVEL.FIRST DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace 3)Testing that Player can add only one LEVEL.SECOND DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace 4)Testing that Player can add only one LEVEL.THIRD DevelopmentCard per DevelopmentCardSpace
    void testDiscardLeaderCard()
    Class used to test the discarding of a LeaderCard 1) Testing player can't discard anything if hasn't any LeaderCard 2) Testing the normal workflow of the method 3) Testing the method in a case where the player has many LeaderCards, where the player has 4 Leader Card 4) Testing an activated LeaderCard can't be discarded
    void testGetConversionStrategies()
    Testing when a LeaderCardColor is activated gives the correct power to the Player
    void testGetDevelopmentCardSpace()
    Testing the generation of the DevelopmentCardSpace for a Player
    void testGetLeaderCard()
    Testing a Player can't get a LeaderCard more the the ones he has
    void testHasDiscount()
    Testing the correct operation of the method 1) Testing when the Player has no discounts 2) Testing when the Player has one or more discounts
    void testIsActionable()
    Testing the method that check if a player can afford the price of a card 1) Testing that a card that does not need anything can always be afforded 2) Testing the case when the player has resources in the standard warehouses 3) Testing the case when the player has resources in the additional warehouses 4) Testing the case when the player has resources in the strongbox 5) testing the case when the player can not afford the price of a card
    void testMoveAheadFaith()
    Testing the correct operation of the method 1) Testing the moving ahead when the Player stays under the 20 points 2) Testing the moving ahead when the Player goes over the 20 points
    void testMoveResources()  
    void testNumOfWhiteMarbleConversionStrategy()  
    void testReturnOnLine()
    Testing the switch of a Player between Online and Offline status
    void testTestCanAfford()
